Claude Monet.passage: "Claude Monet (July 4, 1869 – December 27, 1926) was a French Impressionist painter. He is widely considered one of the most influential and important artists in Western art history. His work was characterized by the color, light, air, and atmosphere. His landscapes are renowned for their impression of light and movement, and he is especially renowned for his series of paintings of the Thames Valley and the London skyline. Throughout his career, Monet explored a variety of techniques including Impressionism, Post-Impressionism and most notably Symbolism. He was an important influence on Post-Impressionist and Impressionist artists such as Henri Matisse and Pierre Bonnard. As the 20th century progressed, Monet's works were less and less sought after, and by the 1960s he had almost disappeared from the art world, although he continued to sell paintings. The majority of Monet's paintings were never exhibited while he was alive. Despite this, his reputation remained strong during his lifetime and has since spread well beyond the art world. There are numerous depictions of his work in the films and on television."

the Delft Guild of Painters.passage: "The Delft Guild of Painters was a guild of painters' founded in 1472, as an extension of the guild of carpenters. It was one of the oldest guilds in the Netherlands and its most important task was the painting of church-ornaments. The guild was also active in many other arts. The guild was abolished in 1735 and was then reestablished on January 1, 1830." My dad was a member of the guild. My grandfather, "Uncle" Jan Rijkeboog, joined the guild in 1775, when he was 15 years old. My grandfather was the third child, I believe, and would have been a child in the school depicted in the photo. When he was about 20 years old, he painted "delft" on a church altar. This was a very small town in the Netherlands and it was a common practice to put the name of the town on paintings. I don't know if this is why they painted it so prominently on the altar. I was just fascinated to find this photo, because it is so different from what you might expect. I grew up in the Netherlands with a family of painters and I have been to Delft many times, but never saw this photo. The Delft Guild of Painters is still very active, as far as I know.

qae_pairs.question: When was the Delft Guild of Painters founded?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Delft Guild of Painters was founded in 1472, as an extension of the guild of carpenters. It was one of the oldest guilds in the Netherlands and its most important task was the painting of church-ornaments.

Vermeer.passage: His work is often compared with that of Rembrandt, with whom he shared an interest in using a camera obscura, or device that produces an upside-down or reversed image. He is also compared with the great Dutch masters painters of the later 17th century, Rembrandt van Rijn and Caravaggio, for their use of chiaroscuro - a system of shading in which the darker portions of the painting seem more distant, providing depth and relief to the composition. However, Vermeer is in many ways more closely related to the artists who followed him.

qae_pairs.question: What famous Dutch painter was Vermeers contemporary and often compared with him?
qae_pairs.explanation: Vermeer was a contemporary of Rembrandt van Rijn, who lived in the 17th century. Both artists were known for their use of chiaroscuro, a system of shading that creates depth and relief in the painting. Rembrandt was also known for his use of a camera obscura, or device that produces an upside-down or reversed image. Vermeer was also compared with the great Dutch masters painters of the later 17th century, including Rembrandt van Rijn and Caravaggio.

qae_pairs.question: What artist, known for his use of chiaroscuro and interest in the Dutch masters, was often compared with Johannes Vermeer?
qae_pairs.explanation: Johannes Vermeer (1632-1675) was a Dutch painter known for his use of chiaroscuro and interest in the Dutch masters. Caravaggio (1571-1613) was an Italian artist known for his use of chiaroscuro and interest in the Italian masters. Both artists were contemporaries and their works were often compared.

Henri-Louis Bergson.passage: Henri-Louis Bergson, French philosopher and writer, is considered to have revived the French philosophical movement in the late 19th century, after the publication of his Le Rire in 1900 ('Smiling' in English, the title was also translated as Laughter in English).

qae_pairs.question: What year did Henri-Louis Bergson publish his book Le Rire?
qae_pairs.explanation: Le Rire (Laughter) was published in 1900.

the Mona Lisa.passage: The famous painting of the Mona Lisa is an oil painting painted by Leonardo da Vinci, painted during the period of 1503 and 1506 in Vinci, Italy. It was completed sometime between 1504 and 1506, at the same time that Leonardo da Vinci began his most famous painting, the Last Supper. The painting is an 8 feet by 4 feet portrait of a woman standing and looking over her shoulder, who is believed to be Lisa Gherardini. It was the most important painting of Leonardo da Vinci's career, and many have said it is the most recognizable painting of all time. This passage describes the painting as "an 8 feet by 4 feet portrait of a woman standing and looking over her shoulder, who is believed to be Lisa Gherardini." It also notes that it is one of Leonardo da Vinci's most famous paintings and that it was painted during the period between 1504 and 1506, at the same time as his other famous painting, The Last Supper.

qae_pairs.question: Who is the woman in the painting, The Mona Lisa?
qae_pairs.explanation: The woman in the painting, The Mona Lisa, is believed to be Lisa Gherardini, the wife of a Florentine merchant. Leonardo da Vinci painted the painting in 1503 and 1506, during the period of 1504 and 1506. The painting is an 8 feet by 4 feet portrait of a woman standing and looking over her shoulder, who is believed to be Lisa Gherardini. The painting is one of Leonardo da Vincis most famous paintings, and it is believed to be the most recognizable painting of all time.
